result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Phillip Britton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#2

records.addlTxt: 4:35  Defendant Barry Phillip Britton in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OSullivan recomends 3 yrs probation on eacn count conc to each other.  Court orders 3 yrs probation on each count concurrent to each other. Cond:   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. No entry into bar or taverns. Comply with AODA treatment currently attending  Comply with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent and complete any treatement recomended. DNA sample and surcharge. Court costs. Defendant is not to have any contact with any known drug users or dealers. 6o days in the Pierce County jail and this is stayed. These days in jail will be available for the agent to use (no more than 10 days per time) if the defendant has some type of violation. These days will be served if imposed, without huber.
copies emailed to Atty OSullivan and Atty Loberg
Sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

4:11 p.m.  Defendant Barry Phillip Britton in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan moves to dismiss Count 3, Amend Counts 1 and 2.  Recommends PSI.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Amended Count 1 and Amended Count 2.    Amended Information to be filed.   Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 and Count 2.  Court dismisses Count 3.  Court orders PSI.  Bond to continue.  Court reviews bond conditions with defendant.  See JA for Sentencing date.  Loberg withdraws motion to supress.
Status conference at 04-04-2016 04:00 pm.
To Suppress.  Filed by Attorney Jens H. Loberg.
Pre-trial conference at 02-11-2016 04:15 pm

4:34 Defendant Barry Phillip Britton in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory E. O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.   Defendant enters not guilty plea on all 3 counts at preliminary hearing.   Not guilty pleas received by the court.   The bond will continue as ordered.   Pretrial Conference to be set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
Arraignment at 01-26-2016 04:30 pm.

03:27 Defendant Barry Phillip Britton in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  O'Sullivan calls Investigator Doug Ducklow.  O'Sullivan examines Inv. Ducklow.  Investigator Ducklow identifies the defendant in the court room.  Jens Loberg x-examines Investigator Ducklow. O'Sullivan requests arraignment be scheduled for a different date.  Loberg requests count 1 and 2 dismissed and misdemenor offense more suitable. The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Court:  O'Sullivan to file amended information for count 1.  Schedule arraignment for 2/26 at 4:30.
Defendant's filed by Atty Loberg
State's

Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
